title: If all TVs run on set-top boxes, why do they still have the old format of channels? Why not have A.V. and home only? - Quora

response.answer_text: What do you mean by “the old format of channels” and “AV and home”? First, new TVs don’t need set-top boxes as the digital receivers are built in. The boxes have a line-level output (via RCA, SCART or HDMI) to connect directly to the TV, and (for the better ones) an RF output which connects to the TV’s aerial socket and is tuned in on a spare channel. If by “the old format of channels” you mean the channel numbers used by the various TV stations, this is retained for the convenience of the viewers. Digital channel numbers - correctly called Logical Channel Numbers or LCN - can in fact be anything, as they are only significant to the box (and the viewer). The LCN is unrelated to the broadcast frequency.
